Blackboard¶

blackboard.AGENDA = []¶

Contains the list of activated KSs awaiting execution.

class blackboard.BB_object(name, data)¶

Contains the name and data of a blackboard object.

blackboard.BLACKBOARD = {}¶

Contains the blackboard database. Version 1: simple dictionary of blackboard objects stored by name

class blackboard.Base_Instance(name=None)¶

The top-level class for any id’d and named object Any child class will have a class attribute

classmethod add_instance(instance_class, instance)¶

Add class instance to instances and instances_by_name

static get_instance_classes()¶

Accessor that should be used to get Base_Instance.instance_classes

classmethod get_instance_id_counter(instance_class)¶
classmethod get_new_instance_id(instance_class)¶
instance_classes = set([])¶
instance_id_counter = 0¶
instances = {}¶
instances_by_name = {}¶
remove()¶
classmethod remove_all_instances(instance_class, verbose=False)¶
classmethod remove_instance(instance_class, instance, verbose=False)¶

Remove class instances from instances and instances_by_name NOTE: does not delete the instance itself, it is just no longer globally stored

classmethod reset_instance_id_counter(instance_class, val=0)¶
class blackboard.Blackboard¶
add_space(space)¶
describe()¶
blackboard.CREATION_EVENT_KSS = [<blackboard.Compute_Squares_KS object at 0x2e08610>, <blackboard.Generate_Integers_KS object at 0x2e08710>, <blackboard.Print_Squares_KS object at 0x2e08790>]¶

Contains KS specifications for all KSs that are interested in blackboard-object creation events (which is the only type of events currently supported). The define_creation_ks macro manages this list.

class blackboard.Compute_Squares_KS¶

KS that computes the square of its ‘bb_obj’ argument.

blackboard.EVENTS = []¶

Contains the events generated by each KSA execution. The events are buffered until execution of the KSA is completed. Then the events are processed by the control components.

class blackboard.Generate_Integers_KS¶

KS that creates new Integer_objects with a value that is 1 larger than its ‘bb_obj’ argument. Creation stops when the value exceeds STOP_VALUE.

class blackboard.Integer_object(value)¶

A blackboard object containing a generated integer.

type_name = 'Integer_object'¶
class blackboard.KS_spec(ks_type_name, object_types, ks_function)¶

Contains the information about a KS needed by the control machinery.

Parameters:
  • object_types (list) – object types of interest
  • ks_function (str) – name of the function implementing the KS
class blackboard.Print_Squares_KS¶

KS that prints the value of the created Square_object (contained in the ‘bb_obj’ argument).

class blackboard.Square_object(value, integer)¶

A blackboard object containing a squared integer.

type_name = 'Square_object'¶
class blackboard.Standard_Space_Instance(name=None)¶
class blackboard.Standard_Unit_Instance(name=None, space_instances=None)¶

The base class for blackboard Units - any object that can be placed on a blackboard space (the term ‘units’ used so as to not be confused with general python ‘objects’)

describe()¶
blackboard.TRACE_LEVEL = 4¶

The current trace level. Trace levels from 0 (none) to 3 (highest) are supported.

blackboard.control_loop()¶

A trivial control loop. No opportunistic control is performed, simply LIFO stack (last-in, first-out) scheduling. The loop terminates when the agenda is empty.

blackboard.create_blackboard_repository()¶
blackboard.creation_event(bb_object)¶

Control component code for processing a creation event. Determines which KSs are interested in the event and adds them to the agenda.

blackboard.delete_blackboard_repository()¶
blackboard.describe_blackboard_repository()¶
blackboard.gensym(name='G')¶

Create a generic name with a guaranteed unique name

blackboard.get_bb_object(name)¶

Trivial retrieval of blackboard object by name. ‘Name’ must be a string.

Also, this _could_ be much more fancy kind of pattern-based lookup depending on the blackboard repository structure.

blackboard.get_gensym_counter()¶

Accessor for gensym counter

blackboard.get_instance_classes()¶

Global interface to extract current Base_Instance classes with some instances

blackboard.make_bb_object(name, data)¶

Makes ‘object’ a blackboard object with name ‘name’ and signals a creation event. ‘Name’ must be a string.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – the name of the bb object
  • data (str) – the bb object’s data
blackboard.reset_bb_system()¶

Resets the system to the initial state.

blackboard.reset_gensym_counter(val=0, verbose=False)¶

Reset the gensym counter, optionally to val

blackboard.run_application()¶

The top-level application function that runs (and reruns) the simple BB application.

blackboard.signal_creation_event(bb_object)¶

Signals that ‘bb_object’ has been created.

blackboard.test_bb()¶
blackboard.test_standard_unit_instance_inheritance(verbose=0)¶

A verbose test that assures we can subclass Standard_Unit_Instance and get desired behavior w.r.t. storing object by id and name in child class NOTE: This also tests the gensym and Standard_Unit_Instance.instance_id_counter and related functions/methods

blackboard.undefine_all_kss()¶

Removes all KS definitions
